page.title: 03CLOUGH DENE/TANFIELD VILLAGE
page.content: Clough Dene is a small settlement of twenty houses on either side of the A6077. There are three footpaths leading from here to Pickering Nook,along Farleigh Burn to the eastern end of Tantobie and another to the west of Tantobie.There is also a cart track which leads from the houses to the centre of Tanfield Moor. A garden centre has been established here.Until recently it was only a part time occupation for the owner. Tanfield village is a settlement of @ 100 houses.There are two public houses,The Pack Horse and The Peacock. Saint Margaret's Church is a notable feature of the village as is Tanfield Hall.There is also a Village hall in the centre of the village.There is only one village shop.
